data.detailedDescription:

For one thing, sellers on the site get to keep 100% of the profits. Hell, even eBay takes a percentage, but that isn’t how it works here, and that’s a big fucking deal. With that in mind, I checked my bank balance and loaded up the site.

Unlike the sketchy text-only websites of the old days, AllThingsWorn makes a strong impression right away with a polished, professional presentation. I really recommend a peek at this section, because the variety of offerings is too wide for me to fully cover in a 1500-word website review. So, How Does This All Work?

It's great that you’ve got so many different options when it comes to getting your used panty fix, but it does highlight one of the downsides of using All Things Worn: the site doesn’t have its own payment/escrow system. While I’d like to think this is a temporary issue, I suspect it’s how they’ll always run the site. The sad truth is that payment processors fucking hate working with adult businesses. You’d probably be surprised by how much sway they have in the porno you watch. Ever wonder why the family-roleplay sites always say “taboo” instead of the dreaded I-word? It’s a very well-built platform, though, so I don’t think they owe their popularity to rarity alone. They’ve created a hell of a platform, giving both sellers and buyers a convenient, attractive and functional marketplace that’s sure to give the other guys a run for their money. If you haven’t checked it out yet, what are you waiting for?
